Osbourne, Metallica, Alice Cooper, Iommi, Rob Zombie, Firewind, Coal Chamber
|website = }} 'John Michael' "'Ozzy'" 'Osbourne' (born 3 December 1948) is an
English heavy metal vocalist and songwriter. Osbourne rose to prominence as lead
singer of the pioneering English band Black Sabbath, whose dark and hard sound
helped spawn the heavy metal genre. Since then he has led a hugely successful
solo career, releasing 11 studio albums, the first 7 of which were all awarded
multi-platinum certifications in the US. In one episode of the reality show
based on the life of his family, The Osbournes, Osbourne refers to himself as
the "Prince of Darkness" , although the term is not generally applied
to him by longtime fans of his music. Osbourne is also known as the "Godfather
of Heavy Metal".

In the early 2000s, he became a star in his own reality show [[The Osbournes]],
alongside wife/manager Sharon and two of their three children, Kelly and Jack. A
documentary about his life and career, God Bless Ozzy Osbourne, premiered in
April 2011 at the Tribeca Film Festival and was released on DVD in November 2011. [http://www.musicfilmweb.com/2011/08/ozzy-osbourne-music-film-
premiere/ Two Nights of Ozzy Doc at a Multiplex Near You] MusicFilmWeb.com
Retrieved 8 August 2011 Osbourne's total album sales from his years in
Black Sabbath combined with his solo work is over 100 million. [http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/267369/ozzy-
osbourne-to-receive-billboards-legend-of-live-award Ozzy Osbourne To Receive
Billboard's Legend Of Live Award] Billboard Retrieved 8 December 2010
